alert.note: Alert for Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:49PM CDT until July 18 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WEAKLEY...BENTON...CARROLL AND HENRY COUNTIES... At 248 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Springville to near Atwood, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 242 PM CDT...a trained spotter reported a 63 mph wind gust at Big Sandy. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Paris, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Camden, Dresden, New Johnsonville, Bruceton, Gleason, Atwood, Vale, Springville, Routon, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, Big Sandy, Henry, McLemoresville, Old Springville, Como and Leach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
